sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content: The Draw.Cls (clear screen) procedure is used to blank the output window The cursor is set to the top left (to row 1, column 1).
sections.text_content: The Draw.Cls (clear screen) procedure is used to blank the output window The cursor is set to the top left (to row 1, column 1).
sections.mdown_content: The **Draw.Cls** (clear screen) procedure is used to blank the output window The cursor is set to the top left (to row 1, column 1).

sections.title: Details
sections.raw_content:
The Draw.Cls procedure sets all pixels in the output window to color 0. In this way it differs from the cls and Text.Cls procedures which set the screen to the text background color.

The screen must be in "graphics" mode. See View.Set for details.

sections.mdown_content:
The **Draw.Cls** procedure sets all pixels in the output window to color 0. In this way it differs from the **cls** and **Text.Cls** procedures which set the screen to the text background color.

The screen must be in "_graphics_" mode. See **View.Set** for details.

sections.title: Status
sections.raw_content:
Exported qualified.

This means that you can only call the function by calling Draw.Cls, not by calling Cls.
